intro: Hieracium mollifolium, commonly known as the downy hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, pastures, and disturbed soils, and can reach heights of up to 60 centimeters. Its leaves are hairy and broadly lance-shaped, while the flowers are yellow with a central disk. It is a perennial species that blooms from late spring to early autumn.
